name: Deathwisp
description: The Deathwisp is a medium-sized undead creature known for its ethereal and haunting appearance, flickering in and out of existence. It wields a spectral weapon called the Ghostly Pike, striking with both force and necrotic damage.
memorable: Its ability to create specters from the spirits of the violently dead makes the Deathwisp a terrifying presence on the battlefield.
goals: To haunt and drain the life of its victims, while commanding the spirits it has collected.
relations: Often encountered with other undead creatures or spirits, seeking to bolster its numbers.
environment: Typically found in dark or shadowy locations, often avoiding direct sunlight.
strengths: Exceptional Dexterity and Charisma allow it to move stealthily and manipulate its environment skillfully.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to radiant damage, especially in sunlight, where its effectiveness is significantly reduced.
attacks: Utilizes multiattack capabilities with its Ghostly Pike and Life Drain abilities, dealing both physical and necrotic damage.
most_powerful_ability: Can create up to twelve specters from recently deceased humanoids, significantly augmenting its combat power.
senses: Possesses darkvision and a passive Perception of 16, allowing it to detect hidden threats accurately.
skills: Highly skilled in Stealth and Perception, making it adept at ambush tactics.
additional_information: Immunities to necrotic and poison damage.
Resistant to multiple damage types including acid, cold, fire, lightning, and thunder.
Incorporeal movement allows it to pass through solid objects.
Does not require air, food, drink, or sleep.
Susceptible to sunlight which imposes disadvantages on attack and perception.
test_queries: undead stealthy creature with life drain
haunting creature that thrives in darkness
undead monster with high dexterity and charisma
ghostly creature that suffers in sunlight
